section.section:
In this part, "low intensity support services" means a program designed to:
Enable a family to provide for the needs of a child or an adult with developmental disability living in the home; or
Support an adult with developmental disability living in the community.
"Low intensity support services" includes the services and items listed in §§ 7-701(d) and 7-706(c) of this subtitle.

text.section: There is a Low Intensity Support Services Program in the Administration.
Low intensity support services shall be flexible to meet the needs of individuals or families.

section.section: The Administration shall establish a cap of no less than $3,000 of low intensity support services per individual per fiscal year to a qualifying individual.
The Administration may waive the cap on low intensity support services provided under paragraph (1) of this subsection.

An individual seeking low intensity support services is not required to:
Submit an application to the Department as provided in § 7-403 of this title; or
Complete an application for the Medical Assistance Program if the low intensity support services will be provided to a minor.
The Department may develop a simplified application process for low intensity support services.

text.section: The Administration shall deliver services to an eligible individual seeking low intensity support services dependent on the availability and allocation of funds provided by the Administration.
